who was a splendid horseman, spurred Bedouin twice and successfully put him to the showy trot in which the animal went when excited. Bend- ing his foaming muzzle to his chest, his tail ex- tended, Bedouin, as if also conscious of the Emperor's eye upon him, passed splendidly, lifting his feet with a high and graceful action, as if flying through the air without touching the ground.
